title: SARS-CoV-2 Whole Genome Sequencing on Illumina - Tiling PCR

source.title: SARS-CoV-2 WvGS protocol - cDNA Preparation Reverse Transcription

source.description:
cDNA/Reverse Transcription Section Date/Initials:_________________
In this section, the nucleic acid extracted and used for the qPCR diagnostic test is used as starting material for the sequencing.

source.title: SARS-CoV-2 WvGS protocol - ARTIC protocol - Tiled PCR

source.description:
Tiled PCR Section Date/Initials:_________________
This section outlines the process for the tiled PCR approach from the ARTIC protocol.
If required resuspend lyophilised primers at a concentration of 100 µM each.
Prepare the primer working solution diluting to
using
TE buffer.

source.body:
Primer pool sequences (v3) can be found here:
https://github.com/joshquick/artic-ncov2019/blob/master/primer_schemes/nCoV-2019/V3/nCoV-2019.tsv

source.description:
[ ] Heat seal and place the plates onto a thermocycler and run the following program.
Important! Heat seal to minimise evaporation.
Note: Amplification should ideally be performed in a different lab to minimise the risk of contaminating other samples.

source.body: Cycle number should be 25 for Ct 18-21 up to a maximum of 35 cycles for Ct 35
Pause point, Amplified cDNA can be stored at (overnight) or up to a week.

PAUSE POINT
Purified amplified cDNA can be stored at -20°C for several weeks prior to library preparation.

source.title: SARS-CoV-2 WvGS protocol - ARTIC protocol - PCR Clean-Up and Size Selection

source.description: [ ] Quantify the sample on Qubit fluorometer or similar instrument and store completed PCR amplified cDNA prep

source.body:
Purified amplified cDNA is quantified with the use of the dsDNA HS Assay kit.
30 uL of samples should contain 50 ng to 1 ug of DNA (optimal 100-500 ng of DNA). If the DNA concentration at this step is less than ~3ng/uL, the sample did not amplify well and it could be under-represented in the final sequencing reaction.
To streamline the workflow, the samples are not normalised but used as input for library preparation, the entire volume is used for the library preparation.
To normalise, add enough DNA to reach a total of at least 100 ng** and add molecular grade water to bring the total volume to 30 µl.
**NOTE: Preferred amount is 100 ng to 500 ng. Less than that can lead to under-representation of the sample in the final pool.

source.title: NEBNext library preparation protocol - Fragmentation/End prep

source.description: This section is an adaptation protocol for FS DNA Library Prep Kit (E7805, E6177) with Inputs ≥

source.body: For inputs < 100 ng, size selection is not recommended. For 100 ng inputs, either the no size selection protocol or a size selection protocol can be followed.

Starting Material
100–500 ng purified DNA. If the input DNA is less than 26 µl, add molecular grade water or 1X TE ( Tris , EDTA to a final volume of .

source.title: NEBNext library preparation protocol - Fragmentation/End prep

source.description:
[ ] Prepare enzyme Master Mix using the following table:
ABC
1ReagentVolume (uL)*(#samples+2)
2NEBNext Ultra II FS Reaction Buffer 7 µl
3NEBNext Ultra II FS Enzyme Mix 2 µl
4Total Volume9 µl

ABC
1ReagentVolume (uL)*(#samples+2)
2NEBNext Ultra II FS Reaction Buffer 7 µl
3NEBNext Ultra II FS Enzyme Mix 2 µl
4Total Volume9 µl

source.body:
Ensure that the Ultra II FS Reaction Buffer is completely thawed. If a precipitate is seen in the buffer, pipette up and down several times to break it up, and quickly vortex to mix. Place on ice until use.
Vortex the Ultra II FS Enzyme Mix 5-8 seconds prior to use and place on ice.

of purified DNA to the mix. Vortex the reaction for 5 seconds and briefly spin in a microcentrifuge.

source.title: NEBNext library preparation protocol - Fragmentation/End prep

source.description:
[ ] In a Thermocycler, with the heated lid set to 75°C, run the following program:
ABC
1StepTempTime
2137°C10 min
3265°C30 min
4Hold4°CHold

ABC
1StepTempTime
2137°C10 min
3265°C30 min
4Hold4°CHold

source.body:
OPTIMIZATION
Fragmentation occurs during the 37°C incubation step.
Use the chart below to determine the incubation time required to generate the desired fragment sizes. Incubation time may need to be optimized for individual samples. Run the fragmented suspension on Bioanalyzer to visualize the size distribution.
ABC
1Fragmentation sizeIncubation at 37°COptimization
2 100 bp-250 bp 30 min 30-40 min
3 150 bp-350 bp 20 min 20-30 min
4 200 bp-450 bp 15 min 15-20 min
5 300 bp-700 bp 10 min 5-15 min
6 500 bp-1 kb 5 min 5-10 min
NEBNext End Prep Vol/PCR RXN (µl)
NEBNext Ultra II End Prep Enzyme Mix 1.2
NEBNext Ultra II End Prep Reaction Buffer 2.8
Total 4
Temperature Time
20°C 30 minutes
65°C 30 minutes
4°C ∞
https://www.protocols.io/view/covid-19-artic-v3-illumina-library-construction-an-bgttjwnn?step=26
If necessary, samples can be stored at – , however, a slight loss in yield (~20%) may be observed. It is recommend continuing with adaptor ligation before stopping.

source.title: Assess Library quality

source.description:
Set up dilutions and standards as laid out in the kit protocol for dsDNA high sensitivity kit.
Record Qubit readings before normalization.

source.body: In this protocol of library ( buffer)

source.title: Assess Library quality

source.description: [ ] Run Samples on a bioanalyser and check that the library shows a narrow distribution with an expected peak size based on fragmentation time and size selection. Record the the average peak bp size.

source.body: tape station D1000 HS of library in buffer (ladder in buffer for each cartridge)

source.title: Assess Library quality

source.description:
[ ] Calculate the dilutions required to normalise each sample to a 4nM concentration using the following formula:
((LibraryConc*(1000)*(1/expected.length)*(1/Average.fragment.length))*1000)

source.body: Note: If a peak ~80 bp (primers) or 128 bp (adaptor-dimer) is visible in the Bioanalyzer trace, bring up the sample volume (from Step 2.5.11.) to 50 µl with 0.1X TE Buffer and repeat the Cleanup of PCR Reaction in Section 2.5.

source.title: Assess Library quality

source.description: [ ] Run Samples on a bioanalyser and check that the library sthows a narrow distribution with an expected peak size based on fragmentation time and size selection. Record the the average peak bp size

source.body:
Calculate the molar concentration of each library to be diluted using average size from the TapeStation and mass from Qubit, using the following equation:
(????????????? (??⁄??)) / (660 ?⁄??? × ??? ??????? ???????? ????) × 10^6 ??/? = ????????????? (??)
Make a 4nM dilution of each library

source.title: MiSeq Sequencing

source.description:
Pooling and Library Denaturation Date/Initials:_________________
This section demonstrates how to generate a pooled library for V3 reagents on the MiSeq.

source.body:
Thaw the MiSeq reagents overnight or in a RT waterbath.
Remove HT1 from freezer and thaw at room temperature.
Store at 2°C to 8°C until you are ready to dilute denatured libraries.

Make a fresh dilution of 0.2N of NaOH and Tris by combining the following volumes in a microcentrifuge tube: 800 uL laboratory-grade water 200 stock 1.0N NaOH
microcentrifuge tube: 800 uL laboratory-grade water 200 stock 1.0M Tris

[ ] Pool
of each normalised sample into one eppendorf tube.

4nM library and
of 0.2 N NaOH.
[ ] Vortex briefly and then centrifuge at 280 x g for 1 minute.
[ ] Incubate at room temperature for

[ ] Add
of 0.2N TrisHCL and
of pre-chilled HT1 to the tube containing the denatured library. The result is 1 mL of a 20 pM denatured library.

source.title: MiSeq Sequencing

source.description:
[ ] Mix reagents of the MiSeq cartridge thoroughly by inverting several times.
[ ] Using a fresh 1000 uL pipette tip, transfer the denatured and library (with PhiX spiked) into position 17.

source.title: MiSeq Sequencing

source.description: [ ] Load the sample sheet and reagents according to onscreen instructions in the MiSeq Control software.

source.title: MiSeq Sequencing

[ ] Incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes

5 uL 4nM PhiX library
5 uL 0.2N NaOH

source.title: MiSeq Sequencing

source.title: MiSeq Sequencing

source.description: [ ] Dilute denatured PhiX library to 20 pM by adding 990 uL pre-chilled HT1 to the PhiX tube. Invert to mix.

source.body:
If using a MiSeq reagent kit v2, dilute 20 pM PhiX library to 12.5 pM by adding the following volumes in a microcentrifuge tube:
375 uL 20 pM denatured PhiX library
225 uL pre-chilled HT1

source.title: MiSeq Sequencing

source.description:
[ ] Combine library and PhiX control according to the table below:

materials.name: NEBNext Multiplex Oligos for Illumina (Dual Index Primers Set 1) - 96 rxns
Q5 Hot Start High-Fidelity 2X Master Mix - 100 rxns
Deoxynucleotide Solution Mix - 40 umol of each
NEBNext Ultra II FS DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina - 96 rxns
MiSeq Reagent Nano Kit v2 (500 cycles)

description:
This SOP describes the procedure for generating cDNA from SARS-CoV-2 viral nucleic acid extracts and subsequently obtaining, through the amplicons tiling, the whole viral genome using V3 nCov-2019 primers (ARTIC). This is followed by library construction and pooling of samples and quantitation, prior to sequencing on the Illumina MiSeq.
The SOP is adapted from the nCoV-2019 sequencing protocol: https://www.protocols.io/view/ncov-2019-sequencing-protocol-bbmuik6w, and it was used in this study:
Lucey M, Macori G, Mullane N, Sutton-Fitzpatrick U, Gonzalez G, Coughlan S, Purcell A, Fenelon L, Fanning S, Schaffer K. Whole-genome Sequencing to Track Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) Transmission in Nosocomial Outbreaks. Clinical Infectious Diseases. 2020.
https://academic.oup.com/cid/advance-article/doi/10.1093/cid/ciaa1433/5909421
